qa_list.question: What time was the report submitted?,answer: The report was submitted at 12 noon Greenwich time (GMT).
What does the acronym GMT stand for?,answer: GMT stands for Greenwich Mean Time.
What is the significance of the numbers in parentheses next to language families?,answer: The numbers indicate the number of evaluated languages in each specific language family.
What does the bold text in the table denote?,answer: Bold text denotes the highest SEScore across models.
What does the underlined text in the table denote?,answer: Underlined text denotes the highest SEScore across LLMs.
Which language family has the highest average SEScore among LLMs?,answer: Indo-European-Germanic has the highest average SEScore among LLMs.
What is the average BLEU score for Eng⇒X translation in Indo-European-Romance language family?,answer: The average BLEU score for Eng⇒X translation in Indo-European-Romance language family is 34.60.
Which language family has the highest average BLEU score for X⇒Eng translation?,answer: Austronesian language family has the highest average BLEU score for X⇒Eng translation.
What is the highest BLEU score for Indo-European-Slavic language family in X⇒Eng translation?,answer: The highest BLEU score for Indo-European-Slavic language family in X⇒Eng translation is 32.26.
Which language in Indo-European-Indo-Aryan family has the lowest SEScore on the table?,answer: Bengali (ben) has the lowest SEScore in Indo-European-Indo-Aryan family.
